programmes.show_name: Romesh Ranganathan: For the Love of Hip Hop
programmes.show_description: Rom catches up with West Coast legend Chali 2na, about his extensive solo career, Jurassic 5 classics and touring. Plus, music from Otis Mensah, Eve and Main Source.
Tony spins the very best in Soul Music, including The Supremes, Donna Summer, Alexander O'Neal, George Benson, Billy Ocean and Shakatak.
Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 1972.
Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 1984.
The Verve's triumphant homecoming concert at Wigan's Haigh Hall in 1998. Featuring Space and Time, Sonnet, The Drugs Don't Work, Lucky Man and Bitter Sweet Symphony.

programmes.show_name: The Unwinds Mix with Angela Griffin
programmes.show_description: Angela Griffin wants you to unplug from the digital world, with an Unwinds Mix featuring Stevie Wonder, Basement Jaxx, Joni Mitchell and more.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 60s with Tony Blackburn
programmes.show_description: Tony brings you two hours of music from the best decade ever, with hits from Harpers Bizarre, The Bachelors and Edwin Starr. This week, the top three comes from 1964.
Oscar and BAFTA nominee Rose Byrne chats about her movie If I Had Legs I'd Kick You. Plus some classic vinyl, a wedding call and The Mystery Voice.
Actor Rosamund Pike (Saltburn, Gone Girl) joins Romesh live in the studio, ahead of the West End transfer of her play 'Inter Alia'.
Spend Saturday lunchtime with Emma and enjoy a menu full of your favourite music, great conversation and a delicious dive into the BBC archives for dessert.
Rylan is joined by the opera and classical vocal powerhouse Katherine Jenkins for a memorable KaRYoke. Also, Mummy Linda and Rob Rinder will be going head to head in a new feature.
Shaun Keaveny sits in with fabulous teatime tunes and your tales of the extraordinary and the everyday.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 80s with Gary Davies
programmes.show_description: Vix from Fuzzbox shares her favourite 80s Moments, and there's a Women Of Rock Mastermix!

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 90s with Fearne Cotton
programmes.show_description: Fearne's looking back at the great and good of the 90s, from Pam and Tommy's nuptials, to the arrival of two Albert Square icons in Eastenders.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 90s with Fearne Cotton
programmes.show_description: Grab the popcorn because Fearne's celebrating all the greatest movie tunes of the 90s, from the likes of Titanic, Austin Powers, Men In Black, Trainspotting, and so many more!
James Morrison introduces a diverse selection of brass music, featuring the Cory Band, Brass Queens and Mike Lovatt's Brass Pack, plus brass covers of Avril Lavigne and Charli XCX.

programmes.show_name: Dance Sounds of the 90s with Vernon Kay
programmes.show_description: Back to back 90s female vocalists including Madonna, Sandy B, Crystal Waters and Lisa Stansfield. And Vernon replays Alison Limerick's Piano Room performance.
Celeste performs This Is Who I Am, her theme written for 'The Day of the Jackal', and covers Labi Siffre's classic Bless The Telephone along with her breakthrough hit, Strange.
Featuring Back For Good, written by Gary for Take That exactly 30 years ago, his take on Sam Fender's People Watching and If There's Not A Song About It with Colbie Caillat.
Featuring her debut solo hit, Forget About Us, Rocket Scientist from her new solo album and the Bon Jovi classic, Always.
Featuring Richard's latest single, Lover, from his forthcoming album, Lovin' You, The Verve classic Sonnet, and a cover of Beach Boy Dennis Wilson's Lady (Fallin' In Love).
Cerys plays her favourite Elvis songs and memories of growing up as a superfan of The King.
Frankie Miller performing live in concert at the BBC's Paris Theatre in 1979. Featuring Be Good To Yourself, Ain't Got No Money, Darlin', A Woman To Love and Brickyard Blues.
Another chance to hear Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe from Pet Shop Boys choose the Tracks of OUR Years, from June 2024.
Jason Mohammad chats to BBC Asian Network's Nadia Ali about Ramadan podcast Not Even Water, which is returning for its fifth season.
Your stories, dedications and classic love songs with Michael... easy like Sunday morning.
Paddy's live from Salford as he asks what do you HAVE to do in your own particular way? Plus The Weekest Link, Sunday Dinners and the always wonderful, Michelle Visage!
Buckle up ... join Michelle Visage on Sunday afternoon for the final time for an upbeat and fast paced show full of the showtunes and soundtracks you love.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 70s with Bob Harris
programmes.show_description: Bob's 'Best of the Test' is from The Police - their very first studio appearance on the Old Grey Whistle Test in 1978.

Tony Blackburn spins his personal pick of the hits from across the decades. To listen on most smart speakers, just 'ask BBC Sounds to play Tony Blackburn's Golden Hour'.
Tracks Inspired By California and Some 'Beautiful' Songs. So expect some Joni Mitchell, The Eagles, Prince, Lana Del Rey, Elvis & REM.
Angela Griffin has a playlist to help you unwind, featuring a Radio 2 Piano Room live track from Labi Siffre.

programmes.show_name: Radio 2 Unwinds Mix with Angela Griffin
programmes.show_description: Escape the chill and bask in some sun with the Winter Sun Unwinds Mix, featuring Randy Crawford, The Beach Boys and Cleo Sol.
